name: TheAtlantic
text: The sublime post-pandemic period that so many are longing for will likely not arrive all at once, like a clock striking midnight on New Year’s Eve, @jpinsk writes. https://t.co/Jnors8BUJ3

name: TheAtlantic
text: A brief, tentative analysis of the winners and losers of the Middle East peace deals, from @JeffreyGoldberg: https://t.co/86nGGmDMxl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This president is different; the rules are different; and if it doesn’t adapt, fast, the press will stand as yet another institution that failed in a moment of crucial pressure," @JamesFallows writes: https://t.co/7UikkiiNiI

name: TheAtlantic
text: South America's largest country has long been ruled by conspiracist thought—and now it's stronger than ever, @Vinncent reports: https://t.co/2k8XmI3Ndn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Coffee growers assumed that the deadly disease devastating their plants could not cross the Atlantic. They were wrong, @marynmck writes: https://t.co/oqYEw2hBj2

name: TheAtlantic
text: The western wildfires reach national political salience. What took so long? Then: Is it just you or is everything sold out? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/IkpCOQLd5l

name: TheAtlantic
text: Is the press making the same mistakes it made in 2016? Then: When will this pandemic be over? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/lkONFoiQtL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Only a few days left until #TheAtlanticFest 2020, featuring guests like Bill Gates, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, and many more. Join us for an exploration of what the United States has faced, and what we will become: https://t.co/Ri8NkZCjiA https://t.co/dUrycyHM8p

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: The Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, wildfire damage in Oregon, flooding in Florida from Hurricane Sally, continued protests in Belarus, smoky skies over Seattle, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/UhziIoQ41t

name: TheAtlantic
text: Get ready for the urban comeback. Then: Go get a flu shot. Do it soon. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/HS0ehZWo5I

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If you take what Bill Barr says when he’s posing as a wise legal theorist seriously, you should be very worried about what Bill Barr is actually doing as attorney general," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/IpWEJImxp1

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos of the Week: Tinside Lido, Log Climber, Dragon Temple - 35 images from the past seven days, including water biking, a Crimean fashion show, fire and flood damage in the U.S., and much more. https://t.co/bvuR7vgPP4 https://t.co/Z15BdehsOj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Climate hell is here. We cannot stand it. And we cannot afford it either," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/DjgIBbvEze

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The world starts to see you as a product...and that's a hard thing to deal with when you're a human." For The Friendship Files, @julieebeck spoke with Veronica Roth and @mstohl, authors of the "Divergent" and "Beautiful Creatures," about mental health: https://t.co/isKxXLJdhA

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Requiring religious people in the ordinary course of their lives to follow the rules that apply to everyone else is not hostility; it is equality," Howard Gillman and Erwin Chemerinsky write: https://t.co/bx3b9QeYPv

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There is no such thing as a singular Latino electorate. There are only Latino electorates, which vary by state, gender, generation, economic status, and their family's nation of origin," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/wxKUa0otj6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books about U.S. history, mass incarceration, urban life, and more offer a look at the profound fractures within America and what it might take to mend them, in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @cray_kate: https://t.co/u99L3qH1UR
